chief.note: No report has been found concerning Carmichael’s presentation of credentials as Chargé d’Affaires en titre; he had already been received as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim on February 20, 1783. He was appointed Chargé d'Affaires ad interim on May 20, 1782.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 26, 1802, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate. Nomination confirmed by the Senate on October 3, 1814; commission following confirmation not of record.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on February 10, 1830, after confirmation.
No report has been found of presentation of credentials, which probably took place about February 1, 1837.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on September 28, 1850, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on March 16, 1870, after confirmation. Presented new credentials on February 2, 1871, after a change of government.
Presented new credentials on March 10, 1875, after the restoration of the monarchy.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on October 30, 1877, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on October 13, 1881, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 13, 1886, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 13, 1888, after confirmation.

ended.note: Spain severed diplomatic relations with the United States on

chief.note: Woodford left post on April 21, 1898. The United States declared war on Spain as of that date by act of Congress approved on April 25, 1898.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 14, 1899, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 8, 1902, after confirmation.
Bowers was resident during the last part of his Ambassadorship at St. Jean de Luz in France; he left that post on June 14, 1939, his appointment having terminated on May 14, 1939.

started.note: Embassy re-established when Matthews was received at Burgos on

chief.note: Proceeded to post, but was not formally received at court; left post about May 20, 1782.
Did not proceed to post.
Took oath of office, but died en route to post. Commissioned during a recess of the Senate.
Declined appointment.
Declined appointment.
Not commissioned; nomination tabled by the Senate.
Not commissioned; nomination not confirmed by the Senate.
Took oath of office, but did not proceed to post under this appointment.
Not commissioned; nomination withdrawn before the Senate acted upon it.
Took oath of office, but did not proceed to post under this appointment.
Not commissioned; nomination of September 17, 1974, not acted upon by the Senate.
